- Large (500): 2,262 vec/s

FEATURES DOCUMENTED:
- CRC32 checksumming for all WAL entries
- Magic number boundaries for corruption detection

Updated for: PyPI publication and production release

feat: Add cross-platform binary build system for d-vecdb-server

MAJOR ADDITIONS:
âœ… Created d-vecdb-server-builds/ directory with complete build infrastructure
âœ… Built production-ready macOS binaries (ARM64 + x64)
âœ… Automated CI/CD with GitHub Actions for all platforms
âœ… Docker-based build system for Linux and Windows
âœ… Comprehensive documentation and build scripts

NEW DIRECTORY STRUCTURE:
d-vecdb-server-builds/
â”œâ”€â”€ .github/workflows/build-binaries.yml  # CI/CD automation
â”œâ”€â”€ vectordb-server-macos-arm64           # Built binary (4.0 MB)
â”œâ”€â”€ vectordb-server-macos-x64             # Built binary (4.6 MB)
â”œâ”€â”€ build-all.sh                          # Multi-platform build script
â”œâ”€â”€ Dockerfile                            # Optimized Docker build
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md                             # User documentation
â””â”€â”€ BUILD_SUMMARY.md                      # Complete build guide

GITHUB ACTIONS WORKFLOW:
- Automated builds for: Linux (glibc), Linux (musl), macOS (ARM64/x64), Windows (x64)
- Creates GitHub releases with all platform binaries
- Triggered on tag push or manual dispatch

BUILD FEATURES:
- Full release optimizations (LTO, opt-level=3)
- Static linking for Linux musl (no glibc dependency)
- Multi-stage Docker builds for minimal images
- Cross-compilation support documented
- Shell script for local Docker-based builds

BINARY SIZES:
- macOS ARM64: 4.0 MB (stripped, optimized)
- macOS x64: 4.6 MB (stripped, optimized)
- All binaries include: WAL protection, GPU acceleration, SIMD, HNSW indexing

- Updated Python client egg-info (vectordb_client â†’ d_vecdb)
- Added hnsw_rs_index.rs for optimized HNSW implementation
- Updated Cargo dependencies and workspace configuration

DOCUMENTATION:
- Platform support matrix
- Quick start guides for all platforms
- Docker build instructions
- CI/CD setup guide
- Distribution instructions for PyPI and GitHub releases

USAGE:
1. Use pre-built macOS binaries immediately
2. Run ./build-all.sh for Docker-based multi-platform builds
3. Push tags to trigger GitHub Actions for automated releases

Ready for production deployment across all major platforms!
